messages.content:
I'm applying to be an exceptional talent to the UK for a visa. Joe Edelman is my friend, use what you know about him and the content I provide to write a great recommendation letter from Joe to the UK visa office:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing to endorse Bilal as an exceptional talent and recognized leader in the field of technology, specifically in the areas of tech innovation spaces and education technology. I have known Bilal since 2014 and have had the pleasure of witnessing his exceptional work in these areas.

As the founder of the School for Social Design, I have worked extensively in the fields of technology and design. I developed the meaning-based organizational metrics at Couchsurfing.com, co-founded the Center for Humane Technology with Tristan Harris, and coined the term “Time Well Spent” for a family of metrics adopted by teams at Facebook, Google, and Apple. My previous career was in HCI and programming language design.

Bilal has been an integral part of the tech innovation and education technology space, and I have been impressed with his work in these areas. His dedication to promoting meaningful technology has been inspiring, and his efforts in building community technology spaces and developing educational software have had a significant positive impact on the communities he serves.

In my opinion, Bilal is an exceptional talent and a recognized leader in his field. He has a unique set of skills and experiences that make him an asset to any organization. I am confident that he will continue to excel in his career and make significant contributions to the community.

Therefore, I highly recommend Bilal for the UK's Global Talent endorsement process. He is a standout candidate who has demonstrated exceptional talent, leadership, and dedication throughout his career. I have no doubt that he will be an asset to any organization and make significant contributions to the UK's economy and community.

Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement, and please do not hesitate to contact me if you require any further information.

Sincerely,

Joe Edelman



bg@bilalghalib.com
can you make it more concise and sound more natural. This is how Joe normally writes: "Joe Edelman




Welcome
Computation
Philosophy
Game Design
Background
I'm a philosopher, game designer, and programmer.

My work finds applications in design methods, product success metrics, market design, recommender systems, AI ethics, social networks, political theory, the foundations of microeconomics, the nature of emotions, etc.

I started an online school, which has a substack and an older medium blog. You can contact me on twitter.

Welcome
Computation
Philosophy
Game Design
Background
Building a Second Heart / Augmenting Human Souls, 2021 A research demo for a writing interface backed by a database of values.

Social Programming Considered as a Habitat for Groups, 2019 A new way to code up social apps and information systems emerges from studying how people use ordinary speech to set up social roles and obligations.

Tech Products (that Don't Cause Depression and War), 2021 An introduction to the Values-Based Social Design method.

Four Ideas for Better Human Systems, 2016 A summary of some technological applications of my research.

Choicemaking and the Interface, 2014 Theories of choice from economics and philosophy suggest information requirements for good choices. In view of these requirements, we can see why current menus lead toward regrettable and isolating choices.

Welcome
Computation
Philosophy
Game Design
Background
Values, Preferences, Meaningful Choice, 2022 I present a conception of values as attention policies resulting from constitutive judgements, and use it to build an alternative preference relation, Meaningful Choice, which retains many desirable features of revealed preference.

Making Values Concrete, 2021 Values as constitutive attentional policies.

How to Design Social Systems (Without Causing Depression and War), 2018 A model of human choicemaking in terms of evolving and practicing values, and a design method to go with it.

Nothing to be Done, 2017 Intellectual history of the west, from a designers' standpoint, as a succession of approaches to human systems.

Is Anything Worth Maximizing, 2016 About how metrics affect the structure of organizations and societies, how they change the economy, how we’re doing them wrong, and how we could do them right.

Welcome
Computation
Philosophy
Game Design
Background
Find my games on meaning.supplies

Welcome
Computation
Philosophy
Game Design
Background
My philosophy work descends clearly from Amartya Sen, Charles Taylor, David Velleman, and Ruth Chang.

In tech, I was lucky to learn from people like Alan Kay, Terry Winograd, and Bill Verplank at Interval Research, from Casey Fenton at CouchSurfing (where I developed the metrics which guided the company), from Howie Shrobe and Marvin Minksy at MIT. And more recently through conversations with Bret Victor and Rob Ochshorn.

My tactic of running social experiments through games and performance emerged from study with Christian Wolff (partipatory music) and Peter Parnell (playwriting) at Dartmouth, and then various improvisational scores with Nancy Stark Smith, Mike Vargas, Ruth Zaporah, and others. I had the great fortune to work alongside Albert Kong and Catherine Herdlick on the real world games festival Come Out and Play.

Finally, I've benefited from conversations with Tristan Harris, Ellie Hain, Nathan Vanderpool, and Anne Selke."
Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing to endorse Bilal as an exceptional talent and recognized leader in the field of technology, specifically in the areas of tech innovation spaces and education technology. I have known Bilal since 2014, and his work in these areas has been truly exceptional.

As a philosopher, game designer, and programmer, I have extensive experience in the fields of technology and design. I am impressed with Bilal's dedication to promoting meaningful technology and his efforts in building community technology spaces and developing educational software internationally.

Bilal's work has had a significant positive impact on the communities he serves, and I believe that he is an exceptional talent and a recognized leader in his field. I highly recommend Bilal for the UK's Global Talent endorsement process, and I am confident that he will make significant contributions to the UK's economy and community.

Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement, and please do not hesitate to contact me if you require any further information.

Sincerely,

Joe Edelman

Dear Sir/Madam,

I'm writing to endorse Bilal as an exceptional talent and leader in technology, specifically tech innovation spaces and education technology. I've known Bilal since 2014, and his work never ceases to impress.

As a philosopher, game designer, and programmer, I've worked extensively in technology and design. Bilal's dedication to creating meaningful technology, building community tech spaces, and developing educational software has greatly benefited the communities he serves.

I believe Bilal is an exceptional talent and a recognized leader in his field. I highly recommend him for the UK's Global Talent endorsement process, confident that he'll make significant contributions to the UK's economy and community.

Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement. Feel free to contact me for further information.

Sincerely,

Joe Edelman

can you subtly add some humble brag elements like As the founder of the School for Social Design, I have worked extensively in the fields of technology and design. I developed the meaning-based organizational metrics at Couchsurfing.com, co-founded the Center for Humane Technology with Tristan Harris, and coined the term “Time Well Spent” for a family of metrics adopted by teams at Facebook, Google, and Apple. My previous career was in HCI and programming language design.
 and the fact he's a part of the rebuilding meaning movement working to align our technology and AI with our values

Dear Sir/Madam,

I'm writing to endorse Bilal as an exceptional talent and leader in technology, specifically tech innovation spaces and education technology. I've known Bilal since 2014, and his work never ceases to impress.

As the founder of the School for Social Design and someone who has worked extensively in technology and design, I understand the importance of meaningful technology. My experience includes developing meaning-based organizational metrics at Couchsurfing.com, co-founding the Center for Humane Technology with Tristan Harris, and coining the term "Time Well Spent" for metrics adopted by teams at Facebook, Google, and Apple. I am also involved in the rebuilding meaning movement, which aims to align technology and AI with our values.

Given my background, I can confidently say that Bilal's dedication to creating meaningful technology, building community tech spaces, and developing educational software has greatly benefited the communities he serves.

I believe Bilal is an exceptional talent and a recognized leader in his field. I highly recommend him for the UK's Global Talent endorsement process, confident that he'll make significant contributions to the UK's economy and community.

Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement. Feel free to contact me for further information.

Sincerely,

Joe Edelman

Can you do the same and for Amr, his background is here: AboutAbout
Amr is the founder of Welnes, a community app for people who want to eat healthy or transform their bodies. He previously co-founded Elk, a startup that builds software and hardware tools to connect makers to the Blockchain and decentralized technologies. Before Elk, he co-founded Integreight right after graduation with a team of electronics and computer engineers. Integreight is the company behind 1Sheeld, an Arduino shield that allows makers to use their smartphones in prototyping, it hit more than 850% of its funding goal on Kickstarter and was shipped in tens of thousands of units to 120+ different countries.

Bilal worked with him on the blockchain project Elk as a researcher and innovation consultant - Amr also knows Bilal from his previous work at GEMSI, the global entrepreneurship and maker space initiative, in Cairo. We worked together to build the innovation community in Egypt

Dear Sir/Madam,

I'm writing to endorse Bilal as an exceptional talent and leader in technology, specifically tech innovation spaces and education technology. I've known Bilal since 2014, and his work never ceases to impress.

As the founder of Welnes and someone with experience in both software and hardware development, I've built a strong understanding of the importance of meaningful technology. My background includes co-founding Elk, a startup focused on connecting makers to blockchain and decentralized technologies, and Integreight, the company behind 1Sheeld, a successful Kickstarter project that revolutionized prototyping with smartphones.

I had the pleasure of working with Bilal on the blockchain project Elk as a researcher and innovation consultant. Bilal's involvement with GEMSI in Cairo also allowed us to collaborate on building the innovation community in Egypt.

Given my background, I can confidently say that Bilal's dedication to creating meaningful technology, building community tech spaces, and developing educational software has greatly benefited the communities he serves.

I believe Bilal is an exceptional talent and a recognized leader in his field. I highly recommend him for the UK's Global Talent endorsement process, confident that he'll make significant contributions to the UK's economy and community.

Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement. Feel free to contact me for further information.

Sincerely,

Amr Saleh

You don't need to emphasize the meaning element. Perhaps you can highlight our collaboration and the innovative nature of hardware blockchain projects and that I'm a recognized leader in the research and innovation sector around new technologies, please don't use my words directly and rephrase it yourself in a way that would sound natural for someone like Amr to write

Dear Sir/Madam,

I'm writing to endorse Bilal as an exceptional talent and leader in technology, specifically in tech innovation spaces and education technology. I have known Bilal since 2014, and his work never ceases to impress.

As the founder of Welnes and someone with experience in both software and hardware development, I've been involved in numerous innovative projects. My background includes co-founding Elk, a startup focused on connecting makers to blockchain and decentralized technologies, and Integreight, the company behind 1Sheeld, a successful Kickstarter project that revolutionized prototyping with smartphones.

I had the pleasure of collaborating with Bilal on the blockchain project Elk as a researcher and innovation consultant. Our work together was characterized by pushing boundaries and exploring the potential of hardware blockchain projects. Bilal's involvement with GEMSI in Cairo also allowed us to collaborate on building the innovation community in Egypt.

Bilal's dedication to creating cutting-edge technology, building community tech spaces, and developing educational software has greatly benefited the communities he serves. He has become a recognized leader in researching and innovating around new technologies.

I believe Bilal is an exceptional talent and a leader in his field. I highly recommend him for the UK's Global Talent endorsement process, confident that he'll make significant contributions to the UK's economy and community.

Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement. Feel free to contact me for further information.

Sincerely,

Amr Saleh

can you write a similar letter for Christy Canida who is Christy Canida (She/Her)  1st degree connection 1st
Senior Director, Product at AlchemistX AlchemistX
AlchemistX is the Corporate Services Division of Alchemist Accelerator
She works in acceleration and has known Bilal since 2009 and has seen him innovate and be creative with technology at Instructables and support innovation communities exploring 3d printing at Autodesk when they worked there together from 2012 to 2016

Dear Sir/Madam,

I'm writing to endorse Bilal as an exceptional talent and leader in technology, specifically in tech innovation spaces and education technology. I have known Bilal since 2009, and his work never ceases to impress.

As the Senior Director of Product at AlchemistX, the Corporate Services Division of Alchemist Accelerator, I have worked with numerous innovative projects and entrepreneurs. My experience has given me a deep understanding of the importance of creativity and innovation in technology.

I had the pleasure of witnessing Bilal's innovative spirit and creativity in technology when we worked together at Instructables. His passion for supporting innovation communities was evident during our time at Autodesk from 2012 to 2016, where he played a key role in exploring the potential of 3D printing.

Bilal's dedication to creating cutting-edge technology, building community tech spaces, and developing educational software has greatly benefited the communities he serves. He has become a recognized leader in researching and innovating around new technologies.

I believe Bilal is an exceptional talent and a leader in his field. I highly recommend him for the UK's Global Talent endorsement process, confident that he'll make significant contributions to the UK's economy and community.

Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement. Feel free to contact me for further information.

Sincerely,

Christy Canida

Can you update this script to answer the following questions?
Script "Dear Sir/Madam,
I'm writing to endorse Bilal as an exceptional talent and leader in technology, specifically in tech innovation spaces and education technology. I have known Bilal since 2011, and his work never ceases to impress.
As the founder of Welnes.app and someone with experience in both software and hardware development, I've been involved in numerous innovative projects. My background includes co-founding Elk, a startup focused on connecting makers to blockchain and decentralized technologies, and Integreight, the company behind 1Sheeld, a successful Kickstarter project that revolutionized prototyping with smartphones.
I had the pleasure of collaborating with Bilal on the blockchain project Elk as a researcher and innovation consultant. Our work together was characterized by pushing boundaries and exploring the potential of hardware blockchain projects. I met Bilal during his initiative to bring makerspaces to Egypt with GEMSI, The Global Entrepreneurship and Makerspace Initiative. We met in Cairo in 2011, where we collaborated on building the innovation community in Egypt.
Bilal's dedication to bringing meaning, values, and creative thinking cutting-edge technology sets him apart. Other than that he is constantly working to include others, building community tech spaces, and developing educational software has greatly benefited the communities he serves. He has become a recognized leader in research and innovation around new technologies.
I believe Bilal is an exceptional talent and a leader in his field. I highly recommend him for the UK's Global Talent endorsement process, confident that he'll make significant contributions to the UK's economy and community.
Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement. Feel free to contact me for further information.
Sincerely, 
Amr Saleh
"
Questions :
"
Be about your Global Talent application - you cannot use a letter that was written for another reason
Explain how the author knows the applicant; and
Knows the applicant’s achievements in the relevant field; and
How the author considers the applicant shows exceptional talent or promise; and
the contribution the applicant would make to the UK digital economy."

Dear Sir/Madam,

I'm writing to endorse Bilal as an exceptional talent and leader in technology, specifically in tech innovation spaces and education technology, for the UK's Global Talent application. I have known Bilal since 2011, and his work never ceases to impress.

As the founder of Welnes.app and someone with experience in both software and hardware development, I have been involved in numerous innovative projects. My background includes co-founding Elk, a startup focused on connecting makers to blockchain and decentralized technologies, and Integreight, the company behind 1Sheeld, a successful Kickstarter project that revolutionized prototyping with smartphones.

I had the pleasure of collaborating with Bilal on the blockchain project Elk as a researcher and innovation consultant. Our work together was characterized by pushing boundaries and exploring the potential of hardware blockchain projects. I met Bilal during his initiative to bring makerspaces to Egypt with GEMSI, The Global Entrepreneurship and Makerspace Initiative. We met in Cairo in 2011, where we collaborated on building the innovation community in Egypt.

Bilal's dedication to bringing meaning, values, and creative thinking to cutting-edge technology sets him apart. Moreover, he is constantly working to include others, building community tech spaces, and developing educational software, which has greatly benefited the communities he serves. He has become a recognized leader in research and innovation around new technologies.

In my experience working with Bilal, he has demonstrated exceptional talent and promise, and I believe he will make significant contributions to the UK digital economy. I highly recommend Bilal for the UK's Global Talent endorsement process, confident that he will make a lasting impact on the UK's economy and community.

Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement. Feel free to contact me for further information.

Sincerely,

Amr Saleh

"Dear Sir/Madam,

I'm writing to endorse Bilal as an exceptional talent and leader in technology, specifically tech innovation spaces and education technology. I've known Bilal since 2014, and his work never ceases to impress.

"

Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing in support of Bilal, a remarkable talent and leader in the field of technology, with a focus on tech innovation spaces and education technology. I have had the pleasure of knowing Bilal since 2014 and have been consistently impressed by his work.

As the founder of the School for Social Design and an individual with a rich background in technology and design, I appreciate the value of meaningful technology. My professional journey includes developing meaning-based organizational metrics at Couchsurfing.com, co-founding the Center for Humane Technology with Tristan Harris, and creating the concept of "Time Well Spent" for metrics adopted by teams at Facebook, Google, and Apple. I am also an advocate of the rebuilding meaning movement, which seeks to align technology and AI with our values.

Given my experience, I can attest to Bilal's unwavering commitment to crafting meaningful technology, fostering community tech spaces, and designing educational software that has a lasting positive impact on the communities he serves.

I am convinced that Bilal is an extraordinary talent and a well-regarded leader in his field. I wholeheartedly recommend him for the UK's Global Talent endorsement process, certain that he will make significant contributions to the UK's economy and community.

Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement. Please do not hesitate to contact me for additional information.

Sincerely,

Joe Edelman

can you modify the following so it is orthogonal to the previous two letters, they can't sound like they're the same at all:
"Dear Sir/Madam,

I'm writing to endorse Bilal as an exceptional talent and leader in technology, specifically in tech innovation spaces and education technology. I have known Bilal since 2009, and his work never ceases to impress.

As the Senior Director of Product at AlchemistX, the Corporate Services Division of Alchemist Accelerator, I have worked with numerous innovative projects and entrepreneurs. My experience has given me a deep understanding of the importance of creativity and innovation in technology.

I had the pleasure of witnessing Bilal's innovative spirit and creativity in technology when we worked together at Instructables. His passion for supporting innovation communities was evident during our time at Autodesk from 2012 to 2016, where he played a key role in exploring the potential of 3D printing.

Bilal's dedication to creating cutting-edge technology, building community tech spaces, and developing educational software has greatly benefited the communities he serves. He has become a recognized leader in researching and innovating around new technologies.

I believe Bilal is an exceptional talent and a leader in his field. I highly recommend him for the UK's Global Talent endorsement process, confident that he'll make significant contributions to the UK's economy and community.

Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement. Feel free to contact me for further information.

Sincerely,

Christy Canida"

Dear Sir/Madam,

I am pleased to recommend Bilal as an exceptional talent and leader in the realm of technology, particularly in the domains of tech innovation spaces and education technology. I have known Bilal since 2009, and his ingenuity and determination consistently leave me in awe.

As the Senior Director of Product at AlchemistX, the Corporate Services Division of Alchemist Accelerator, I have had the opportunity to collaborate with a myriad of inventive projects and entrepreneurs. This experience has enabled me to appreciate the significance of resourcefulness and innovation in technology.

I had the privilege of observing Bilal's inventive prowess and resourcefulness in technology during our collaboration at Instructables. His enthusiasm for nurturing innovation communities was palpable throughout our tenure at Autodesk between 2012 and 2016, where he was instrumental in delving into the potential of 3D printing technology.

Bilal's unwavering commitment to forging cutting-edge technology, cultivating community tech spaces, and designing educational software has had a profound impact on the communities he serves. As a result, he has established himself as a respected leader in the research and innovation of emerging technologies.

I am confident that Bilal is a rare talent and a leader in his field. I wholeheartedly endorse him for the UK's Global Talent endorsement process, with the certainty that he will make substantial contributions to the UK's economy and community.

Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement. Please do not hesitate to contact me for additional information.

Sincerely,

Christy Canida
Too many adjectives make it shorter, simpler, straight to the point and kind

Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing to recommend Bilal as an exceptional talent in technology, focusing on tech innovation spaces and education technology. I have known Bilal since 2009 and have witnessed his impressive work.

As the Senior Director of Product at AlchemistX, I have collaborated with various innovative projects and entrepreneurs. I can attest to the importance of creativity and innovation in technology.

Bilal and I worked together at Instructables and later at Autodesk from 2012 to 2016. During this time, his passion for supporting innovation communities and exploring 3D printing technology was evident.

Bilal's dedication to creating advanced technology, building community tech spaces, and developing educational software has greatly benefited the communities he serves. He is a respected leader in researching and innovating new technologies.

I wholeheartedly endorse Bilal for the UK's Global Talent endorsement process, confident that he will contribute significantly to the UK's economy and community.

Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement. Feel free to contact me for further information.

Sincerely,

Christy Canida

As the founder of the School for Social Design and an individual with a rich background in technology and design, I appreciate the value of meaningful technology. "

I am writing in support of Bilal, a notable talent in technology, focusing on tech innovation and education technology. I have known Bilal since 2014 and have admired his work.

As the founder of the School for Social Design, I understand the value of meaningful technology. My experience includes developing metrics at Couchsurfing.com, co-founding the Center for Humane Technology, and contributing to the rebuilding meaning movement.

Thank you for considering Bilal for this endorsement. Feel free to contact me for more information.
